definition: A small, nocturnal mammal with wings that enable it to fly, typically found in caves or dark areas. It is known for its ability to navigate and locate prey using echolocation. This term is commonly used to refer to a specific animal species.

examples.german: Die Fledermaus fliegt in der Nacht.
Fledermäuse orientieren sich mit Hilfe von Ultraschall.
Fledermäuse sind in vielen Kulturen mit Aberglauben verbunden.
examples.english: Bats are associated with superstition in many cultures.
